description:
My favorite tea place on the earth. Healthy and tasty. New concept of drinking tea.
I often wait for the promotion 50% off for stocking teas. I think the price is a little high when you buy full price. There are so many favors so it might be confusing for you to choose. But you will find some of your favorite. My favorite is Peach Matai, or green tea.
author: Kev W.

description:
It's a chain, but you probably knew that already, huh. It was founded in Montreal almost a decade ago by yes, Canadians, who must have seen a gaping hole in the market for tea-totaling Canucks. Apparently they don't all guzzle beer up north. They swept southward into our country about six years ago, and Oprah suddenly promoted them about four years ago. Well, that sealed the deal since her endorsement is the retail equivalent of the golden fleece. And the rest, as the French Canadians say, is histoire.

Jamie W. and I happened upon the one in the Westfield food court as we've been in a heavy tea mode of late. It definitely has the packaged look of a chain that paid a lot for image consultants. The ritzy Tiffany blue of the sign, the tea cups and even the tea tags attest to that. Dozens of uniform canisters were neatly organized on shelves behind the counter organized by what kind of tea (photo: http://bit.ly/2pI2Bzo). Perky staff were more than willing to allow us to smell any tea to which I showed even the slightest curiosity.

After much staring, Jamie settled on the Mint Chocolate, and I got sassy and ordered the Sweet Ginger Heat (photo: http://bit.ly/2raw6v1). At a not unreasonable $3.50 a cup, both were satisfying with mine having a little bite that I welcomed. There is plenty of designer merchandise to peruse while you wait for your tea to steep (photo: http://bit.ly/2qd6sYM), though nowhere to sit. That meant we had to sit among the lobster-gorging, cream puff-devouring patrons out in the court. It was a calorific jungle out there, but we survived.

TEA - 4 stars...rich tea flavors, endless variety available
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...it's just a store with a lot of color-coordinated merchandise
SERVICE...3.5 stars...they're a happy lot in here, must come with the training
TOTAL - 4 stars...Oprah was right...these Canucks know how to make tea
author: Ed U.

description:
I am a tad bit obsessed with tea and David's Tea in general and was really impressed with the service I received at this location. This is a pretty small storefront and I honestly didn't know what to expect since before my visit my DAVIDsTEA purchases have always been online or through a friend going to their home storefront. 

First off, I really have to give props to the employees here! My sister and I came packed with a bunch of questions and inquiries to smell the different teas and they never made us feel like we were wasting their time or we were annoying them by how excited we were about tea! They also offered us the available samples of tea (hot/cold) located in the front of the store.

Secondly, the store was clean and organized. You could easily find what you need, but don't fret if it's hard to locate what you want the staff is there to help you and to also answer any questions.

Third, DEALS! They have a sale section and you never know what you'll find here. Sometimes it's mugs! Sometimes it's iced tea presses. You just never know, so it's always worth stopping by just to check-in. Also in addition to their teaware also having deals as the seasons change so do the teas and the stocks of what they keep (for some, but not all teas) and sometimes teas go on sale! Keep your eyes peeled or just ask!

Overall, I dig tea and I dig this spot. Definitely will return for more! 

Recommendations?
- Iced Tea Press was a game changer for me. You basically brew loose leaf tea on the bottom, add ice to the inner cup, layer? Idk what it's called and press once it's done brewing and BAM yummy tea! 
- Goji Green - delicious. Just yum.
- MATCHAAAA is yummy. They also have fruity flavors like Honeydew matcha! 
- If you're not sure you're going to love a tea, but it smells good and you like the ingredients opt for 2oz over anything larger.
author: Janelle V.

description:
David's Tea is the best.  Discovered it staying at a house rental in British Columbia a few years ago, and didn't realize this great Canadian import is now readily available stateside.  Cut forward a few years and there are several Nor Cal outlets, including this one in the lower level of the Westfield SF Center, adjacent to the food court.

Here you can buy loose leaf teas, tea in bags, and some very well constructed infusers, brewing tools and tea holders.  Even if you are lukewarm on tea in general, you'll find something to like here and it's fun to explore their flavors.  The fruit infusion teas here are better iced than just about anything you'll find elsewhere.

Its a hassle for some to get here, unless you are coming via public transport.  A major plus is that in the back of this tiny shop you can order fresh brewed hot and ice tea, in all flavors.  This is a must try if you are in Westfield Center.
author: Rachel H.

description: These people will actually give you a recommendation if you describe what you're looking for. What a concept! You can order hot or cold and even a latte. I opted for something refreshing and citrusy and iced. I ended up with the electric lemonade which is a mate - delicious! I'll be back!
author: Guisela L.

description: Join and you get a free tea!! I miss teavana and this is the just like it but more trendy and colorful. I love the colors and the ombré. Tea is so good too!! I love that they even have sales. It's a tea girls tea heaven inside the West field mall so accessible by Bart
author: Diane S.

description:
I purchased a teapot "simplicity tea for one" for my hubby and the inside lip cracked after the first use. The issue is with store management treating me like I was a scam artist for returning their cheaply made merchandise. And a ceramic object that cracks after the first use is highly suspect in my opinion. 

The fact is that my hubby loved the actual product, just not the fragility of the craftsmanship. The extra star is for the manager refunding the product albeit with major attitude accompanied by a tone of accusation: "if I research you and find a pattern..." he began his tongue lashing... as if I would give myself the task of returning your cheap teapot after intentionally cracking it. "Well I've sold a lot of these and none came back," was his response. There are most likely many customers with hairline cracks in their teapots who've already tossed their receipts.
author: Ronald P.

description:
Came to this location to learn that David got rid of my favorite tea!! Farewell Kiwi's Big Adventure! I guess the adventure has come to an end :(

I've tried others and this time around I tried the Happy Kombucha. Nothing has beaten the Kiwi. I guess i will keep searching.

This location did not ask if my tea was okay (sweetness level, etc.), which the Palo Alto location always did so the service didn't feel quite as welcoming. 

Regardless, David's tea is still one of my favorite places for a nice cup of iced tea because of their bountiful selections and types of sweeteners.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Hot soothing tea is magic for the soul and David's Tea has a tea for everyone. Their cult favorites like Forever Nuts, Cream of Earl Grey, Red Velvet Cake, and Chocolate Covered Banana make for magical gifts for tea newbies, and their sublime Grand Cru Matcha and Silken Pu'erh would impress most tea gurus.

You can tell that the staff are true tea lovers and I've always enjoyed talking to them.

This past week - I bought one of their reliable travel mugs as well a travel matcha maker mug. Both have proved to be two of my favorite tea making accessories.

For your own motivating matcha magic - check out DAVIDsTea.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I have a great love for this DavidsTEA location. I found out about them and their awesome tea because I was drawn to this store front 4 years ago. Ever since then, I've been a loyal customer of DavidsTEA.

Items, especially if they're on sale, sells out fast here. I don't normally go to this location to buy loose tea or bottles but I do come here to grab iced teas. 

Employees are usually quick and attentive but sometimes you'll come here and employees will ignore you and that really depends on how many people are in the store and who is working.
author: Kelly L.

description:
3.5 STARS

We were gifted a box of teas from one of our talent for the holidays. I'm not normally a fan of fancy teas. I just drink chinese chrysanthemum bo nay all the time, but I had just ran out, so I decided to try David's tea.

We got the Sachet tea chest: whole leaf tea in sachet format ($40) which came with 8 different teas: Buddha's blend, Organic silk dragon jasmine, Organic the skinny, Organic cream of earl grey, Coffee pu'erh, The buzz, Organic cinnamon rooibos, Forever nuts.

I've tried most of the flavors from the box. I'm a very simple tea drinker. I tend to like my teas strong and I don't add any sugar, cream or milk. Call me a tea purist, but I liked the more simple teas from the box: Buddha's blend, Organic the skinny, The buzz. I could taste the subtle notes of each tea which I started appreciating. Gave me a whole new view of drinking tea.

As a coffee and tea purist, I couldn't really drink the Organic cream of earl grey or Coffee pu'erh. The cream of earl grey had an overwhelming smell and taste of vanilla. For a girl that doesn't add anything to her tea, it was a big turn off. And the coffee pu'erh seemed like a watered down coffee. I like my coffee dark and strong, so I didn't care for that at all.

For anyone who loves different types of tea, a box from David's Tea would make for a great gift. But for me, I'm okay sticking to my normal boring tea. Rounding up from 3.5 stars for giving me a new appreciation for specialty teas.
author: Elena N.

description: I'm not really a tea person... more of a coffee person for sure, but recently my stomach has had a different opinion on what I should be putting in me, so I headed over to David's to see what they had going on. As someone who only knows the super basics about tea, I was completely overwhelmed and confused when I walked in. Luckily, they have some incredibly helpful, knowledgeable staff that can help you figure out what it is that you're looking for, and explain what the hell a tea ball is, and how it differs from an infuser. Definitely ask for help if you feel lost, because they seem more than happy to tell you about the kazillion different teas they offer and what is in them, and how those things can help you. I walked away with 3 fancy pants new teas and some fill your own tea bags (who knew?!) I basically feel like the Queen of London now. Someone hand me some freakin crumpets! (What is a crumpet?)
author: Liz M.

description: I love the location in Palo Alto, but I've only had bad experiences at this SF store. I tried getting a sample because there was a pitcher sitting outside with some cups nearby, but one of the staff members yelled at me and made me feel like I had just tried shoplifting. I'm sure it's just because the staff here are more busy so they have to be curt, but it did hurt my feelings and gave me trepidations about ever returning.
author: Jeddeo P.

description: A place to come back! Finally I found infuser tea infuser mugs  they have so many great quality teas and really good deals! Come here to try cold/hot teas  thank you for high quality service
author: Evelina K.

description:
I like coming here when it's not that crowded just to ogle at their beautiful Nordic cups. I recommending buying one when they have sales or deals; they are really quite nice cups! 

I'm also a fan of their matcha lattes which come out pretty smooth and creamy. As for their other teas, I like their straight teas, but need to dive in to see what other blends I might like.

I gave this place five stars because I think their SAs are really friendly and have good service. I'm indecisive and I exchanged teas two times, and they were more than happy to do so. Wherelse I'm sure most places would give me the crazy eye for doing so.
author: Maggie L.

description:
Small tea place on the side of the food court. 
No big difference in the tea, but the products and holiday teas they have are worth getting! This weekend they have a holiday sale on the remaining Christmas products and tumblers and I'd definitely check it out. 
The assortment of teas they have is average, with a whole wall of black, green, white, herbal, and much more. 
The prices are average. 
The staff is friendly and over zealous. 
Check it out, see for yourself!
author: Lianne W.

description:
I first tried David's Tea when I went to their Burlingame location which is wide open and allowed space for a tea newbie like me to ask questions and sample different teas.  Inside the Westfield Cellar Food Court area, it just seems like a congested non relaxing type of place to sample and taste tea in the proper setting.  The mall's ambient noise kiind of ruins it.  I wore my thick bulky backpack while I was in there and then realized later on that I almost smacked two or three people in the face when I was turning in one direction.  So I ended up sitting on the bench outside.

Probably will stick with the ample roomy Burlingame location for me.
author: Ben H L.

description:
In the mall by the main food court area but its small and cramp. Have a lot of selection of tea to choose from. You can either go by the oz to bring home or go by the cup either hot or cold.

The person who was helping me was nice and was very helpful on picking what kind of tea i wanted  for my cough/sore throat. They let you smell the tea leaf containers to see if you like the smell that they suggest for you. Totally forgot the name of the tea that i got by the cup to go. Usually i dont add any honey to my tea since i prefer the original flavor but decided to Add a little honey to my tea for my sore throat. If you add honey to your tea, it gives that extra flavor/sweetness. 
I'm a fan of David's tea and will come back next time i go to the mall
author: Julie N.

description: Worst first experience due to the older man at the register. Worst bitchy attitude, unwilling to help or even be cordial or serviceful even after we told him it was our first time. Pour honey on my iced tea... it's not going to dissolve. Asked politely for a spoon as he was watching me struggle to mix the hardened honey at the bottom and he just dismissed me by saying he didn't have any. I can't believe people act like they own the place or like they can behave like that and expect costumers to go back. If you can't be, at least, pleasant don't work in costumer service.
author: Johnny A.

description:
DavidsTea X 3. 

My third DavidsTea location. While the chain was founded in Canada, they've started to pop up around NorCal within the last year!

And everyone knows OMGITSDAVIDSTEA. Yep, I love it!

Location specific:
-In the mall
-Lots of samples. Most locations give samples in glass cups, but I assume the mall location merits the throw-away cups.

Why?
-Best tea flavors ever. Grilled pineapple tea, birthday cake, Movie night (yep, popcorn in the mix), cotton candy!
-They don't hard sell like teavana. The Teavana handbook must teach employees to be in your face - Teavana is like a Macy's sell (besides the fact that the sales people are non-existent but stick with my metaphor please) and David's is more a Bloomies or Neimans. 
-Teapop= tea mixed with carbonated water. A cool concept.

Yeah, it'll cost you a pretty penny, but it is totally worth it!
author: Libby J.

description:
Sooooo much different teas that I get overwhelmed on which ones to choose. Therefore before I go here I make a list of teas that sound good from their website . The staff is very helpful. 
Random fact .... I did not know trail mix could be used as a tea .
author: Joseph M.

description:
DavidsTEA in the SF Westfield Centre is very colourful and full of any tea you could possibly fancy. I prefer coming here for tea instead of the dodgy tea shops in China Town. You can order any tea hot or cold which is lovely cos sometimes you just need a cuppa. I love their Autumn collection cos its very warmy. Try the Pumpkin Spice Chai Tea with milk and sugar. 

The staff are friendly and knowledgeable and spend time with customers instead of rushing them. Their are plenty of gift sets as well that could be given to a Tea fanatic like myself.
author: Julian I.

description:
Stumbled into this store after wanting a cup of tea while shopping around downtown.  I didn't want the usual Peet's or Sbux...right next to Ghirardelli, I spotted David's Tea.  Now, I can't wait to return!

The associate behind the counter utilized my usual preferences and found me a couple of their blends that I might like.  G did the same and had a couple of choices also.  They have single blends...but I wanted to try something different.  

They can brew you up a perfect cup of tea...or make it iced.  The iced option is actually super intriguing.  You have the choice between regular water or sparkling.  Add agave?  

We decided on one plain hot and one iced with agave.  

Both were fantastic.  I highly recommend getting the sparkling one if you get iced.  It's different and unique.
author: Jen W.

description: I'm so obsessed with this store! They have a dizzying variety of loose leaf teas, ranging from the standard traditional blends to some pretty out there ones like a Cotton Candy Rooibos. I also love the design style of all of their different cups, teapots, etc. and definitely plan on picking something up at some point. If you choose to just get a drink to go, they brew your tea there fresh, and have a variety of different sweetener options as well. My favorites I've tried here so far have been mint matcha and forever nuts!
author: Stephany L.

description:
Well they certainly have a lot of tea!! It's literally wall to wall. At the front are small samples for their flavor of the day. Although not your traditional tea shop, they do have many interesting flavors. 

My friend loves this place because you can go in there and tell them how you're feeling or what's hurting and they can recommend something for you. I'm not saying that it necessarily works but placebo is a powerful thing. ;-)

Worst case scenario you get a delicious hot cup of tea.
author: James W.

description:
Knowledgeable staff, fragrant loose leaf, refreshing tea! I encountered DavidsTea when I was wandering around the mall seeking something to satisfy my overwhelming thirst. Upon consulting Yelp, DavidsTea appeared with an overall glowing review. 

The store is very bright, clean, and modern looking. I was promptly greeted by the two employees working that day, a lady with purple hair and a gentleman wearing a beanie, both of which were very patient, friendly, and informative. 

I was first provided a sample of the summer dragonfruit tea, and it was light and delicious. I however, was seeking some more caffeine kick. All of the teas smelled amazing, and I had lots of trouble choosing one. Ultimately I chose the Shooting Starfruit, which was fruity but not overwhelming. There is none of that artificial smell or taste found in drinks at other tea places. They use an agave sweetener that doesn't alter the tea, letting the flavor of the leaves shine through. 

They also sell tea bags, tins of teas, hot drink thermos cups, iced drink cups, and their neato burrito steeper. I always have trouble making teas that water down after adding ice, but this is a nifty device for brewing, filtering, and dispensing right over your cup. 

I wish there was a location closer to the South Bay. I would revisit if in the area to try their unique flavors and buy some loose leaf for home.
author: Shirley V.

description:
I just had a wonderful experience at the SF Center Location! 

David and the other associate (who's name I didn't catch) were so helpful! I walked in having an idea of what I wanted, but not really sure. They both were speedy, efficient, and conversational. 

I manage a boutique and I'm always underwhelmed by customer service these days. This is the exact experience that I love when I go into stores. Shout out to your manager for recruiting a staff of people that work together, are knowledgeable, have passion for what they sell, and do it with a smile. 

I took queen of tarts with me and I absolutely love it! If you like a deep, rich, citrus tea - it's spot on!
author: Devin L.
